body.p:
Augusta Ky
March 20th 1862
Gov. Magoffin
Dear Sir

At the request of the father of Johnson Mains now in the Penitentiary for Horse Stealing I write you -- I have conversed with my brother W. C. Marshall and many other intelligent, & prominent citizens of our County. & all say they are satisfied their was no criminal intent in the taking of the Horse -- The father of the young man is poor, but honest & none sustains a more unexceptionable character for morality & good
citizenship -- I think from all I have learned in reference to his case, your interposition in his behalf would be eminently just & right -- My brother informs me that he has written you, giving you a full history of the case & therefore I forbear to bore you --

My best wishes for your health, prosperity & distinction
Sincerely yr Sv
Thorton, F. Marshall
